page.title: 20WARMINSTER'S FUTURE
page.content: According to the latest Wiltshire Structure Plan the population of Warminster is unlikely to rise very much in the near future.Most new house building is confined to infilling open spaces within the built up area of the town. Large scale housing developments are limited because little new land is available for development.To the north is Salisbury Plain, used by the Army for training.On the other three sides of the town are landscapes of high value, including the Wylye Valley and Longleat. The average age of Warminster's population seems likely to rise.There are already a number of old people's homes & there are many retired people living in the town.Most people in the town will continue to work in service activities as new industries in the town seem unlikely in the near future.
